> This post. I hate it.

His lantern is just a shield, right? I need to flash away from danger, right?
</s>

{{champion:67}} "hmmm, Thresh just threw me a lantern. What does it mean? He's known as a play making support, so by doing this, he wants to make a play? His lantern DOES shield me, and there ARE 5 enemies over there. I know! he wants me to flash tumble into their team and pentakill!"

An ally has been slain

{{champion:412}} "Ok, the flash I've gotten used to. But if you're going to ignore the lantern, at least flash AWAY from them next time?"

{{champion:67}} "GG, useless sup."

Almost choked on my breakfast reading that. 

GG. +1

....
Seriously?

This is why we Thresh mains hate ignorant teammates.

In Bronze Thresh gets 3 abilities and a mini shield.
No, not seriously. Which is why I added </s>

What does </s> stand for? 
It some sort of kappa equivalent?
sarcasm.
Thank you kindly sir for informing me of this internet jargon.
Even with the </s> i still got triggered. People really have no idea
It doesn't even work half the time when I click it with either mouse button
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5VndhGmalVI

another youngster found the thresh gif.

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-popcorn}}
Nothing feels better than saving an ally who should have been dead. Tilts the enemy so hard. :)
Saving 4 allies and yourself when you all should have been dead is probably more tilting. Namely {{champion:13}} and {{champion:16}} from from {{champion:30}}'s ult

{{champion:67}} Nothing beats outplaying your opponent with skill and talent, the feeling when I land my  E skill shot followed by a single auto to win my lane. Tilts the enemy so hard. 
:)
holy shit you vayne op bandwagoners really go hard on the forums hey

*Is Thresh main.*
SO. RELATABLE.
Yet in my elo only pre made ADCs actually click on the lantern...
cry.
{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
TRUTH!
